title: Systems Administrator - IFS
description:
**Responsibilities:**

* Install, configure, and maintain IFS applications to meet business requirements.
* Implement and manage system configurations, including customization and integration with other enterprise systems.
* Monitor the performance of IFS applications, identify bottlenecks, and implement solutions to optimize system performance.
* Conduct regular system health checks and proactively address potential issues.
* Provide technical support to end-users, addressing IFS-related queries and issues.
* Develop and deliver training programs for end-users and other IT staff to ensure proficient use of IFS applications.
* Implement and maintain security measures to protect IFS applications and data.
* Ensure compliance with industry regulations and internal security policies.
* Plan and execute upgrades and patches for IFS applications in coordination with stakeholders.
* Test and validate changes to ensure system stability after updates.
* Develop and maintain backup and recovery procedures for IFS applications and associated data.
* Perform regular backups and conduct recovery drills to ensure data integrity.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, business analysts, and other IT professionals.
* Communicate effectively with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide status updates.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field preferred
* **Experience with cloud versions of IFS is a MUST**
* Proven experience as a Systems Administrator on IFS applications.
* Hands-on experience with IFS version upgrades, patches, and system configurations.
* In-depth knowledge of IFS applications, modules, and associated technologies.
* Familiarity with database management systems (e.g., Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server) supporting IFS.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration and user support.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: From $35.00 per hour

* 401(k) matching

* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Education:

title: Data Architect
description:
Great Culture, Great People, Great Company
  
If you’re looking for a company that’s big enough to have exciting and challenging business opportunities, yet small enough to make a personal impact – WoodmenLife may be the place for you.
  
We’ve been a fixture in downtown Omaha over 130 years, and we promote a family-first environment with flexible work schedules, a team-oriented atmosphere, and a culture that encourages personal and professional growth, knowledge, and community involvement.
  
As a not-for-profit, WoodmenLife is a different kind of insurance company. We give back revenues to our members, not investors. We’ve been around for more than a century because we’ve always kept our promises. Through recessions and wars, we’ve remained stable and reliable.
  
If you want to be part of an organization where you’re not just an employee – you’re a valued member of the family – WoodmenLife is the place for you!
  
Quote from current associate about why they love this position:
  
“As a data architect for WoodmenLife, you get to work with an amazing team and for a great company. Data is at the heart of all the ongoing projects and initiatives so there are opportunities to be involved in work from all areas of the company. As a data architect you get to use your problem solving and design abilities to help shape the future at WoodmenLife.”
  
  

**Quote from the Manager about why they love this position:**  

“Do you like to produce data models that make a difference? Do you enjoy gaining the understanding of how data relates to the business processes and enhancing that knowledge through your modeling skills? This is the job for you. You will be in the middle of growing this enterprise knowledge with a fun energetic team. WoodmenLife needs you!”
  
  

**POSITION PURPOSE:**  

The Data Architect focuses on the efforts to build a cohesive enterprise data strategy, evangelizing data’s potential and building the organizations analytical skills. Delivers data architecture designs on assigned projects and initiatives.
  
  

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:**  

* Acts as the Data Architect for assigned company initiatives. Organizes the database development effort and acts as the senior technical data resource on complex and critical projects.
* Understands the information needs of the enterprise with emphasis on executive information consumption and data that comes from or is provided to parties external to the enterprise.
* Participates as a member of the Enterprise Architecture Board, which helps develop the long-term vision of how to apply Data decisions that supports the organization’s strategy and leads initiatives that implements the appropriate Data technology.
* May work on more than one enterprise project in support of another architect, engaged up to 50% capacity performing execution activities.
* Oversees, directs, and/or provides consultation on database implementations and improvement activities for projects or high impact work activities.
* Leverages internal and external data sources to enhance the consumer experience and create additional opportunities for sales.
* Collaborates with Solution Architects on architectural decisions to ensure solutions are designed for successful implementation within the vision of the enterprise architecture.
* Assists in technical discussions with vendors and provides input regarding Data storage, consistency and integrity considerations of the system.
* Ensures team follows defined Data security and Data integrity processes throughout product lifecycle to achieve delivery dates on time with quality.
* Ensures adoption of standards in use by engineers and developers to promote repeatable successful projects.
* Educates upward and outward about the business value of enterprise data architecture and data management.
* Analyzes business context (trends and business strategy), as well as change requirements in other architecture viewpoints and integration architecture to derive the Data architecture future state.
* Directs, coaches and mentors staff to ensure engagement and productivity levels are maintained; sets clear objectives and compares deliverables against objectives.
* Performs other duties as assigned by management.


Minimum Qualifications
  
  

This job requires a background that demonstrates the following minimum knowledge, skills, talents and traits:
  
* Bachelor’s degree or at least six years’ experience in a multiple vendor RDBMS environment.
* Four or more years’ experience in a technical (hands-on) database, data warehouse or data engineering leadership role; ability to lead, motivate, and develop a group of professionals capable of achieving aggressive business goals and objectives.
* Data modeling and information classification expertise at the enterprise level.
* Solid understanding of Service-Oriented Architecture and the processes of mapping, managing, and moving data through different logical layers of architecture.
* Familiarity with Master Data Management (MDM), business intelligence, and data warehouse development techniques.
* High level of Data Security awareness.
* Understanding of the differences between relational and object modeling.
* Knowledge of modeling practices and tools such as mind-mapping, UML, ERWIN diagrams and others.
* Ability to motivate and gain acceptance for your ideas.
* Experience working with Portfolio Project Management Office (PPMO) to establish realistic delivery estimates.
* Detailed knowledge of current technologies and developments in the software & systems engineering industry.
* Strong communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills are a must as is the ability to embrace change in a positive and enthusiastic manner.
* Ability to define problems, establishes facts, draw valid conclusions and be able to manage multiple project deadlines.
* Ability to provide seamless, trustworthy, attentive and resourceful (S.T.A.R.) customer service.
* Ability to engage well with others and passionate about providing an exemplary customer experience.
* Meets expectations for attendance and punctuality in accordance with the expectations established by supervisor and WoodmenLife policy.


Desired Qualifications
  
* Knowledge of the insurance/financial services industry.
* Microsoft SQL Server Certified.
* Broad multi-platform, multi-technology development experience.
* Prior job experience as a data warehouse programmer/manager, database administrator or data architect is a plus.


WoodmenLife offers a competitive compensation package and a comprehensive benefits package (https://www.woodmenlife.org/careers/home-office/benefits/). As part of WoodmenLife’s employment process, candidates will be required to complete a criminal background check, credit check (where required for position), Fingerprint check (where required for position), drug screen and reference checks. Any offer of employment will be contingent upon successfully passing the above.
  
WoodmenLife is committed to excellence in diversity by creating an inclusive work environment that values and respects all individuals. We welcome and embrace associates, regardless of background and beliefs. WoodmenLife respects every associate’s unique perspective and contribution. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment that values differences, and creates opportunities for growth, leadership and service. This commitment includes providing equal opportunity in recruitment, employment and promotion, training and community outreach. WoodmenLife is also dedicated to strengthening the communities in which its employees live.
  
APPLICANTS WITH DISABILITIES SHOULD ADVISE THE HUMAN RESOURCES DEPARTMENT AT THE TIME OF APPLICATION IF SPECIAL ACCOMMODATIONS ARE NEEDED.
  
Woodmen of the World Life Insurance Society (WoodmenLife) is an equal opportunity employer.

description:

title: iOS Developer
description:
The Mobile Specialist participates in project planning, including resource estimation, and in the creation and review of technical deliverables. The Mobile Specialist works in conjunction with other technical team members in all phases of the Agile Scrum SDLC.

This position will participate as a key technical position for DEP’s mobile inspection applications. The mobile inspection applications are being built on an iOS platform. The resulting data is received into DEP’s enterprise system via services. The backend database is Oracle 19C. This position will be responsible for serving as the designer, developer and/or engineer on multiple mobile inspection applications. They will work with the end user stakeholders at times, various Business Analysts (BAs) and Project Managers (PMs), and other technical staff in defining and managing the business and technical requirements. The candidate will be responsible for developing and/or engineering a user interface, a service tier, data tier components, and/or infrastructure or security for the mobile projects by working with the team leads.

Attention to reusable components and repeatable processes is required for developing the iOS solutions utilizing, but not limited to, Objective C, Swift, JSON, XML, and consumption of RESTful web services. The candidate will develop applications that link to a web service-oriented backend solution.

Additionally, a solid understanding and experience in Apple’s technologies is required, including but not limited to the distribution of certificates, provisioning profiles, code signing, keychains, push notifications, app transport requirements, and iOS version histories. The candidate should have a strong knowledge of iOS frameworks related to UI, Core Data, storyboards, web services, security/keychain, camera integration, asynchronous/background processing, multitasking, etc. Also, a strong understanding of MVC, delegation, target-action and Cocoa layers related to Touch, Media, OS and Services and Objective/C and iOS principles of memory management, notifications, blocks, categories, etc. is strongly helpful.

The ideal candidate will assist in project planning, including the development of timelines. They must understand Agile Scrum methodology and participate in daily standups. The selected candidate is expected to assist in the development and review of technical deliverables on the projects.

**Required/Desired Skills:**

Required - 6yrs - Full SDLC experience as an application developer

Required - 5yrs - Experience with object-oriented development

Required - 5yrs - Experience with iOS SDK and Objective-C

Required - 5yrs - Familiarity with Swift programming language and latest iOS APIs and frameworks

Required - 5yrs - Experience with Core Data framework

Required - 5yrs - Experience with relational database design and development

Required - 4yrs - Experience with iOS Auto Layout, Storyboard, Blocks and GCD

Required - 2yrs - Experience in architecting & solutioning mobile apps that consumes web services

**Desired Skills:**

Highly desired - 5yrs - Experience with deploying iOS apps

Highly desired - 1yrs - Experience in a team leadership position

Highly desired - 1yrs - Experience with deploying enterprise iOS apps via MDM

Highly desired - 5yrs - Experience with HTML5 development and JavaScript frameworks

Highly desired - 2yrs - Experience with Java centric server-side development and solutioning

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: From $70.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Hourly pay
* Performance bonus

Experience level:

title: Cloud Database Engineer
description:
WW is looking for candidates to help change people’s lives. We are a global wellness technology company inspiring millions of people to adopt healthy habits for real life. We do this through engaging digital experiences, face-to-face workshops and sustainable programs that encourage people to move more, shift their mindset and eat healthier while enjoying the foods they love. By drawing on over six decades of experience and expertise in behavioral science, we build communities in order to deliver wellness for all.
We are looking for individuals who have strong experience in backend development specializing in database as a service with deep experience in Open Source database technologies like MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and other Cloud Native database technologies
This role will suit someone adaptable, flexible, and able to succeed within an open collaborative peer environment
We would love to hear from you if you have hands-on experience in designing, developing, and managing enterprise-level database systems with complex interdependencies and have a key focus on high availability, clustering, security, performance, and scalability requirements
Responsibilities
This position is responsible for managing and monitoring WW production Database Infrastructure:* Focus on automation to improve availability and scalability in our production environments
* Work with developers to improve database resiliency and improve/implement auto-remediation techniques
* Provide support for large-scale database instances across production, non-production, and development environments
* Serve in a rotational on-call and weekly maintenance supporting database infrastructure
* Support regular upgrades and patches to maintain security vulnerabilities
* Support database scalability


Skills/Qualifications* 3+ years experience in managing and automating mission-critical production workloads on MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and other Cloud native databases
* Experience with database architecture, design, replication, clustering, HA/DR
* Extensive experience using Linux or Unix
* Hands-on experience with at least one of the Cloud technologies on AWS, GCP or Microsoft Azure
* Experience managing clustered, highly-available database services deployed on different flavors of Linux
* Knowledge of automation tools such as AWS Cloudformation, Terraform, and Ansible
* knowledge of streaming technologies like Kafka is a plus
* Working experience in modern DevOps technologies and container orchestration (Kubernetes, Docker), service deployment, monitoring, and scaling


Base salary may vary depending on, but not limited to: skills, experience, and location. Base Salary is $135,000 - $155,000K/annually.
At WW, it is our priority to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are committed as individuals, as an organization, and as fellow humans, to advocate for and support our employees, our members, and our communities. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, creed, national origin, marital status, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

title: BI/Report Developer
description:
**Position:** BI/Report Developer  



**Job Location:** Farm Credit Bank of Texas, Austin, Texas; Telecommuting (work from home) permitted within metropolitan statistical area.  



**Job Duties:**

* Collect and document business requirements from end-user to improve, develop, and customize the current data application and solution processes [5% of time dedicated to this duty].
* Create MicroStrategy schema objects and application objects including attributes, facts, metrics, user hierarchies, and reports using MicroStrategy BI Framework [20%].
* Create SQL stored procedures, views, and triggers to acquire the data from database to develop reports and dashboards [10%].
* Develop, test, and implement productive and viable program logic for existing and new applications using principles including Kanban and Scrum [15%].
* Design high level Extraction/Transform/Load (ETL) process and data flow from source system through to the data warehouse using Informatica [10%].
* Design rich dashboards with Power BI and prepare user stories to create compelling dashboards to deliver actionable insights [20%].
* Create complex reports in MicroStrategy Desktop using its functions/features, including templates, transformations, custom groups, and consolidations [20%].

In connection with above duties, utilize experience in Reporting: MicroStrategy, Power BI, and SSRS; ETL: Informatica and SSIS; SQL; DBMS; and Data Analytics.  

* 
**Requirements:** Master’s degree in Industrial Management, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field plus 2 years experience in job offered or 2 years experience in related occupation using experience in Reporting: MicroStrategy, Power BI, and SSRS; ETL: Informatica and SSIS; SQL; DBMS; and Data Analytics.  



In lieu of Master’s degree, employer will accept Bachelor’s degree in above listed fields plus 5 years of progressive work experience in related occupation. Experience may be gained concurrently. Employer will accept any suitable combination of education, training or experience.  



Telecommuting (work from home) permitted within metropolitan statistical area.

title: NodeJS/JavaScript Developer
description:
NodeJS/JavaScript Developer
  

  

Position Description
  

CGI has an immediate need for a NodeJS/JavaScript Developer to join our financial services team with preferred locations in Lafayette, LA This is an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced team environment supporting one of the largest leaders in the secondary mortgage industry. We take an innovative approach to supporting our client, working side-by-side in an agile environment using emerging technologies.  

* We partner with 15 of the top 20 banks globally, and our top 10 banking clients have worked with us for an average of 26 years!
* We have over 92,000+ CGI Members in 40 countries and over 5k+ loyal Clients who are leveraging our end-to-end services across the globe

  

Preferred location is Lafayette, LA, but the position is open to Remote work anywhere in the US where there is a local CGI Office.  

  

This person will lead the implementation of Backstage and any custom development that is needed, in collaboration with the DevOps teams leading our CI/CD tools efforts. This person should be familiar with develops practices and methodologies and integrating custom apps with enterprise tools, such as Jira, Confluence, Jenkins, and GitHub/GitLab. Git-based development experience is a must, as is working with OAuth and other SSO-enabling technologies.  

  

Your future duties and responsibilities  

* Advanced proficiency in coding in NodeJS, and Java technologies as well as unit testing/Mockito experience and Cucumber Automation Testing.
* Work on cloud transformation effort, move application components to AWS, update code, and create/run CICD pipeline.
* Work with product owners and other development team members to determine new features and user stories needed in new/revised applications or large/complex development projects.
* Create or Update documentation in support of development efforts. Documents may include detailed specifications, implementation guides, architecture diagrams or design documents.
* Participate in code reviews with peers and managers to ensure that each increment adheres to the original vision as described in the user story and all standard resource libraries and architecture patterns as appropriate.
* Participate in all agile ceremonies including planning, grooming, product demonstration, and team retrospectives.
* Leverage client DevOps tool stack to build, inspect, deploy in the cloud platform, test, and promote new or updated features.
* Understand the application code with minimal assistance and resolve bugs/defects/performance issues identified.

  

Required qualifications to be successful in this role  

* 5 years of experience with Node.JS and JavaScript development
* Proficient in JavaScript frameworks
* Git-based development experience is a must, as is working with OAuth and other SSO-enabling technologies.
* Core Java experience is a Must
* Expert knowledge and experience with JSON / XML / RESTful Web Services and services integration with NodeJS
* Strong relational database skills in Oracle/MySQL
* Proficient with CI/CD tools including Jira, Confluence, Jenkins, and GitHub/GitLab
* Responsible for working on on-prem and AWS environment
* Defines objectives by analyzing user requirements; envisioning system features and functionality
* Designs and develops the application following Agile methodologies.
* Experience in customer-facing role
* Excellent organizational and communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Ability to work independently

  

Educational Requirements
  

Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Systems or related field  

  

#LI-LB3  

#DICE  

  

CGI is required by law in some jurisdictions to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. The determination of this range includes various factors not limited to skill set, level, experience, relevant training, and licensure and certifications. To support the ability to reward for merit-based performance, CGI typically does not hire individuals at or near the top of the range for their role. Compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range for this role in the U.S. is $59,700.00 - $146,900.00.  

  

We offer a competitive compensation package where you'll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our benefits package includes multiple medical, dental, & vision options, both a Shared Purchase Plan (SPP) for CGI stocks and a 401(k) plan, as well as numerous other lifestyle benefits. CGI also provides sick leave and vacation pay.  

  

\\*\\*CGI anticipates accepting applications for this position through April 3, 2024.  

  

**Insights you can act on**  

  

While technology is at the heart of our clients' digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.
  

  

When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today - one of the world's largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.
  

  

At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.
  

  

Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI - where your ideas and actions make a difference.

title: Senior Technical Content Developer - Support
description:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.


This **Senior** **Technical Content Developer** **- Support** role will be responsible for designing and developing product and process training for internal Technical Support audiences. This role will focus on all phases of the training design and development cycle (analysis, design, development, delivery, and evaluation) and requires strong project management skills. This role will play a pivotal part in Snowflake's overall Support learning strategy, contributing to the effective development of Support employees technical and customer service skills.


**RESPONSIBILITIES**:


* Design and develop innovative learning solutions applying adult learning principles and systematic instructional design to create content that fits the learner's needs ensuring performance-based learning outcomes (includes online, classroom, virtual instructor-led training, and blended learning content).
* Lead the creation and distribution of internal technical courseware at Snowflake, including developing exercises, tutorials, job aids, assessments, and other learning methods, including social or connected learning strategies and multimedia-based assets.
* Develop hands-on labs, data generators, and grading applications; build and maintain lab server environments.
* Collaborate effectively with key stakeholders and subject matter experts to understand the needs of our partners, customers, and employees to develop internal training.
* Translate complex technical concepts and components into accurate and impactful visual aids.
* Scope internal training development projects, estimate the time required accurately, manage and report on progress, and employ leadership skills to drive projects to successful completion aligned with plans.
* Manage multiple concurrent projects and consult widely across organizations to determine objectives; locate all information needed to develop courses; when obstacles arise, communicate promptly.
* Utilize subject matter expert time efficiently after first pursuing answers independently; build solid relationships with colleagues across organizations.
* Ensure learning and performance objectives are practical and tailored to the learner and that the training materials meet performance objectives.


**PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:**


* Minimum of a bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Data Systems, Technical Communication or Technical Training
* 8+ years of training curriculum design and development experience (including designing technical training for various modalities such as hands-on labs, eLearning, videos, ILTs, etc.).
* Ability to conduct Train the Trainer sessions for Instructor-Led training content
* Over 3 years of hands-on experience with major cloud provider services (AWS, Azure, GCP), and in SQL programming, and database systems.
* Proficient in core concepts like Cloud Deployment, Infrastructure, system architecture, Linux CLI, computer networking, and distributed systems.
* Knowledge of data-driven technologies, including Database/SQL, ETL, data pipeline, Snowflake, AI, and ML.
* Direct experience with instructional design models such as ADDIE, Bloom, Gagne, SAM, etc.
* Professional experience using elearning software (Articulate, Captivate, or similar) and LMS (Cornerstone, Workday, or similar).
* Demonstrated hands-on experience of elearning and video editing tools, such as Articulate, Captivate, Camtasia, Final Cut, Adobe Premiere, and After Effects,
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, including skills in collaborating with subject matter experts and managers to help design and develop training.
* High aptitude for managing and solving tactical issues.
* Outstanding problem-solver, negotiator, diversity advocate, and relationship-builder.
* Able to grasp and convey the highly technical subject matter. Certification from AWS, Snowflake, or other cloud vendors preferred
* Excellent time management skills with the ability to coordinate and prioritize effectively.
* Able to work in a dynamic, ever-changing environment with a sense of urgency.

title: Lead WordPress Developer (North America)
description:
The Lead WordPress Developer will lead both as an inspiring people manager and as a skilled technical contributor. At Catena, our development teams operate with agility, self-sufficiency, and a deep understanding of translating business problems into impactful web solutions. For this role, a strong background in WordPress development and a passion for leading teams to success is paramount.
### **SCOPE OF THE JOB:**

+ Offer technical leadership and insight on WordPress development best practices.
+ Act as a senior hands-on contributor, setting the bar for quality and innovative solutions.
+ Stay updated on the latest WordPress trends, technologies, and tools to ensure the use of cutting-edge solutions.
+ Implement and oversee rigorous testing processes to ensure the stability, security, and performance of WordPress websites.
+ Coach, mentor, and elevate members of the team to excel in their roles, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment.
+ Collaborate with project and product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to define project requirements and goals.
+ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate WordPress solutions with other systems and platforms.
+ Collaborate with the Director of Engineering on both technical and organisational strategies.
+ Manage a geographically diverse team, ensuring streamlined communication and coordination, especially with outsourcing partners.
+ Translate business requirements into efficient WordPress designs and architectures.
+ Prioritise and delegate tasks, ensuring timely and quality deliveries.
+ Conduct thorough code reviews, ensuring best practices and coding standards.
+ Document technical processes and workflows for enhanced team productivity.
+ Guide the team in deploying updates and new features to live WordPress environments.

### **Leadership and team management responsibilities:**

+ Managing team performance effectively through the practicing of ongoing performance management, including conducting performance reviews and regular 1-1 meetings
+ Leading by example by delivering positive results and being a visible Catena ambassador
+ Communicating effectively and ensures information is delivered in a clear and timely manner
+ Taking ownership of recruitment and selection for your team by working closely with HR and TA teams
+ Enabling team and individual growth from induction stage to ongoing learning and development

### **TO DO IT, YOU WILL NEED:**

+ Profound expertise in WordPress development and PHP.
+ Proficiency with GIT for version control.
+ Familiarity with CI/CD tools and methodologies.
+ Experience with container technologies like Docker.
+ Knowledge of database solutions, specifically MySQL (familiarity with MongoDB is a plus).
+ Previous experience in an affiliate marketing or lead generation organisation would be advantageous.
+ Previous experience in a lead or managerial role, demonstrating leadership and mentorship capabilities.
+ Excellent communication skills and the ability to convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.

title: EDI Boomi Specialist
description:

title: Data Engineer (Junior)
description:
**Secure our Nation, Ignite your Future**


Become an integral part of a diverse team while working at an Industry Leading Organization, where our employees come first. At ManTech International Corporation, you’ll help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.


Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, career and customer-oriented Junior Data Engineer to join our team. This is a hybrid role that requires 1 day a week on site at L’Enfant Plaza.

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**

* Create database models and components.
* Assist in the design of data pipelines, data models, profiling/cleansing the data, and performance tuning.
* Develop and maintain data pipelines, data workflows, ETL/ELT scripts or packages.
* Conducts tests.
* Tests data pipelines.
* Provides test results and recommends more complex corrections to senior developers.

**Basic Qualifications:**

* 2+ years of Relevant Experience
* Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in Engineering, Mathematics, or Business

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience engineering Disparate Data Sets from multiple systems.
* Experience with moving data across multiple platforms.

**Security Clearance Requirements:**

* US citizenship with the ability to a Public Trust Clearance.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50%.
* Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine and computer printer.
* The person in this position frequently communicates with co-workers, management and customers, which may involve delivering presentations. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations.


The projected compensation range for this position is $72,100-$120,900. There are differentiating factors that can impact a final salary/hourly rate, including, but not limited to, Contract Wage Determination, relevant work experience, skills and competencies that align to the specified role, geographic location (For Remote Opportunities), education and certifications as well as Federal Government Contract Labor categories. In addition, ManTech invests in it’s employees beyond just compensation. ManTech’s benefits offerings include, dependent upon position, Health Insurance, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, Holiday Pay, Short Term and Long Term Disability, Retirement and Savings, Learning and Development opportunities, wellness programs as well as other optional benefit elections.
For all positions requiring access to technology/software source code that is subject to export control laws, employment with the company is contingent on either verifying U.S.-person status or obtaining any necessary license. The applicant will be required to answer certain questions for export control purposes, and that information will be reviewed by compliance personnel to ensure compliance with federal law. ManTech may choose not to apply for a license for such individuals whose access to export-controlled technology or software source code may require authorization and may decline to proceed with an applicant on that basis alone.


ManTech International Corporation, as well as its subsidiaries proactively fulfills its role as an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, marital status, physical or mental disability, status as a Disabled Veteran, Recently Separated Veteran, Active Duty Wartime or Campaign Badge Veteran, Armed Forces Services Medal, or any other characteristic protected by law.


If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a position with ManTech through its online applicant system, please contact ManTech's Corporate EEO Department at (703) 218-6000. ManTech is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer - minorities, females, disabled and protected veterans are urged to apply. ManTech's utilization of any external recruitment or job placement agency is predicated upon its full compliance with our equal opportunity/affirmative action policies. ManTech does not accept resumes from unsolicited recruiting firms. We pay no fees for unsolicited services.


If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access http://www.mantech.com/careers/Pages/careers.aspx as a result of your disability. To request an accommodation please click careers@mantech.com and provide your name and contact information.

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
### **Job Summary**


The Senior Developer will be responsible for leading the development and support of at least one of our primary internal applications. This person will work to create and enforce the company's coding standards and practices. This person will advise management of emerging trends in technology. This person will also work to mentor other developers.

  

1. Work with Project Managers, Product Owners, and other developers to lead the development of custom software applications.

  

2. Develop code in alignment with company’s coding standards

  

3. Assist in creating and enforcing company’s coding standards

  

4. Develop custom WEB APIs to integrate software components.

  

5. Write unit tests as needed for their or other’s software components.

  

6. Design and implement security measures for their assigned application area.

  

7. Maintain knowledge of current and evolving technology, evaluate changes in or new technology, and provide management with information relevant to new technologies (hardware, software, or services) that could be beneficial.

  

8. Complete work accurately and on time.

  

9. Mentor at least one other software developer.

  

10. Perform additional responsibilities as assigned.

### **Requirements**

  

1. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  

2. Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, troubleshooting skills, and problem-solving skills.

  

3. Experience in an agile and scrum environment.

  

4. Ability to analyze information and recommend achievable process improvements to management.

  

5. Self-motivated and able to organize, prioritize and manage multiple complex tasks.

  

6. A working knowledge of web security principles and other security systems.

  

7. Ability to mentor and lead other developers.

 **TECHNOLOGIES:**  

1. Experience with developling code within Salesforce

  

2. Experience working and developing with TypeScript

  

3. Must be familiar with at least one modern front-end technology like Angular

  

4. Must be familiar with at least one modern back-end technology like NodeJS

  

5. Experience with at least one modern database tool like SQL Server or Oracle

  

6. Familiar with microservices architecture and container technology like Docker

  

7. Experience with GIT source control.

  

8. Experience working and developing against REST and SOAP API’s.

  

9. Specific coding languages include but are not limited to: C#, Typescript and JavaScript.

 **JOB REQUIREMENTS:**

  

1. Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field or equivalent of specialized courses, training, and/or directly related experience may be substituted.

  

2. A minimum of five years of similar or related functional and technical experience. At least two of these years should have been in Salesforce Development.

  

3. Knowledge of the Financial Industry, products, and services. Credit Union experience preferred.

  

4. Ability to travel to complete assigned responsibilities and attend professional seminars and education as approved.

### **Benefits**

**General Ones:**  

* PTO super flexible
* Work from anywhere
* Continuous training program
* Talks and workshops on personal and professional growth
* Organizational team building events
* Rewards
* Social Responsibility committee
* Developer’s day celebration
* Birthday off
* Monthly kudos
* Holiday celebration day off
* 70+ Partnerships with restaurants, hotels, hiking groups, fitness, stores, medical services, psychology services, dental services, universities, pet supply services, pet medical pharmacy chains, events, and car services.

 **Payroll only:**  

* Legal benefits
* Life and medical insurance
* Vacations
* Paternity and maternity leave
* Birthday gift card

title: Associate Software Development Engineer (Python)
description:
You will work with our development engineers and designers to build the next generation of our SaaS and mobile products that will improve patient care. We are an agile development shop and demo our work to project stakeholders. To support this methodology, we practice continuous integration, embrace open-source software, and empower our developers to make informed technology and product decisions.



Reporting to the Development Manager you will be part of our Engineering team based remotely in the US.


**What You’ll Be Doing – the day-to-day:**


* You can expect to work across the whole stack, from front-end code, through back-end services, serverless, SQL, to name but a few. We value competency, tenacity and problem-solving, and you’ll find plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and technologies, or even introduce your own best practices into your new team.
* **Our current stack:** Python, JavaScript, AngularJS, and Mongo. This is what you can expect to work with, but we are always open to using other technologies where they add value!
* Our development engineers lead by championing a culture of personal ownership and customer-focused execution. We love those who pride themselves in how they contribute through excellent solutions and end-user experiences, as much as clean and clear code.
* We are an Agile development shop and interact regularly with project stakeholders, including demos from each sprint. To support this methodology, we use regular retrospectives and objective measurements to drive continuous improvement and empower our developers to make informed technology and implementation decisions. As part of the development process, you will be involved in design sessions and you’ll have the opportunity to learn and teach through peer review of code and of completed solutions.


**Who you are - some of the essential things required to be successful in the role;**


* 2+ years' experience in software engineering. Your experience should include:
+ Application development in Python
+ Unit testing and mocking frameworks (unit test, pytest, etc.)
+ Git for source control
+ Knowledge of OO concepts and design patterns,
+ SQL and relational database concepts
+ Modern web frameworks/concepts (e.g. restful APIs, web sockets, etc.)

**Who you are – it’s desirable if you have experience of any or all of the following;**


* Exposure to Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment practices.
* Experience with serverless architectures.
* Exposure to Cloud Platforms (Azure / AWS / GCP).

**Benefits & Perks**

ESO offers a comprehensive suite of benefits to promote health and financial security for our employees and their families. For full-time employment you this includes:
* Competitive health plans (medical, dental, & vision insurance)
* PTO (starting at 20 days) & 12 company holidays
* 401(k) with company match
* Telemedicine service provided by ESO
* Savings accounts (FSA, HSA, DCA)
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Annual health and wellness reimbursement
* Peace of mind benefits such as life insurance, disability insurance, and worksite benefits
* Paid parental leave, new child program, & flexible parental return-to-work options
* Casual office environments and unlimited office snacks and drinks


**About ESO**

ESO is a fast-paced, growing data, technology, and research company passionate about improving community health and safety through the power of data. We pioneer innovative, user-friendly software to meet the changing needs of today’s EMS agencies, fire departments, and hospitals. We’re small enough to be nimble and fun, but big enough to be a great place to work. We serve thousands of customers out of our offices across the US, Canada and Northern Ireland.

**Are you ready to Make a Difference?**  

  

At ESO, we believe in bringing your true self to work every single day. If you don’t match all the qualifications on the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway! We are looking for passionate, innovative, and authentic people to help drive our mission.

All offers are contingent upon a successful background check.  



*ESO is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We invite you to consider opportunities at ESO regardless of your gender; gender identity; gender reassignment; age; religion; race; national origin; political affiliation; sexual orientation; disability; veteran status; or other non-merit factor.*

title: Business Analyst
description:
Overview:

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented **Business Analyst** to join our Customer Experience team. As part of this team, you will have the opportunity to work on the creation of transformational customer experiences including new digital portal, generative AI technology and dynamic routing capabilities. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between business needs and technological solutions. As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with stakeholders to gather, analyze, and document business requirements, facilitate communication, and ensure that project goals are met successfully. **\\*We’re opening this role to candidates located in commuting distance from our Durham, NC office as this will be a hybrid role.\\***
Responsibilities:
* **Requirements Gathering:**
* Collaborate with business stakeholders to elicit, analyze, and document detailed business requirements.
* Conduct interviews, workshops, and surveys to gather information from various sources.
* **Analysis and Documentation:**
* Analyze and document current state processes, systems, and workflows.
* Develop clear and concise business requirements, user stories, process flows, and other documentation as needed.
* Ensure that requirements are aligned with business goals and objectives.
* **Data Analysis:**
* Perform data analysis to support business needs, including data mapping, validation, and cleansing.
* Collaborate with data architects and database developers to design effective data solutions.
* **Communication:**
* Facilitate communication between business stakeholders and the project team.
* Present findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* **Quality Assurance:**
* Work closely with QA teams to ensure that testing efforts align with business requirements.
* Lead & participate in user acceptance testing (UAT) and provide support during the testing phase.
* **Continuous Improvement:**
* Identify opportunities for process improvement and propose effective solutions.
* Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies.
* **Project Management:**
* Assist in project planning, monitoring, and tracking to ensure timely and successful project delivery.
* Collaborate with project managers, developers, and other team members to achieve project objectives.

Qualifications:
* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar role.
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
* Proficient in the use of business analysis tools and methodologies.
* Familiarity with project management concepts and practices.
* Experience in data analysis and modeling is a plus.
* Experience working with global teams is a plus.


About Avalara:
**About Avalara:**  

We’re building cloud-based tax compliance solutions to handle every transaction in the world. Imagine every transaction you make — every tank of gas, cup of coffee, or pair of sneakers, every movie ticket, meal kit, or streamed song, every sensor-to-sensor ping. Nearly every time you make a purchase, physical or digital, there’s an accompanying unique and nuanced tax compliance calculation. The logic behind calculating taxes — the rules, rates, and boundaries is a global, layered, three-dimensional mess of complexity, with compliance dictated by governments and applied by every business, every day.  

Avalara works with businesses of all sizes, all over the world — from corner stores to gigantic global retailers — to calculate tax accurately and automatically, at speeds measured in milliseconds. That’s a massive technical challenge, in terms of scale, reliability, and complexity, and we do it better than anyone. That’s why we’re growing fast. Headquartered in Seattle, Avalara has offices across the U.S. and around the world, in Brazil, Canada, India, U.K, Belgium and across Europe. **Equal Opportunities:**
  

Avalara is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, creed, religion, age, gender, national orientation, disability, sexual orientation, US Veteran status, or any other factor protected by law.

title: Senior Software Developer, CX Billing and Self Service
description:
Do you have a passion for elegant solutions to complex problems? Are you into the details? Want to work on mission critical customer facing systems that a are top enterprise priority? Want to make a difference in the day-to-day life of customers by saving them time? We are reimagining the billing and payment customer experience and evolving the MyIDEXX platform to new heights. This is your chance to become part of our growing team of creative and talented individuals who are passionate about the customer experience.
  
  

As an experienced Software Developer, you will be a key member of the team, contributing to the design and development of new features and enhancements that will be used by thousands of customers . Our team is small and fast moving so you should be as comfortable designing a new feature as you are writing and debugging code. You will work with a closely knit team of developers, analysts, designers, product managers and testers so excellent communication and interpersonal skills are a must.
  
  

The ideal candidate will have a solid background in JavaScript development with an emphasis on the full web application stack and a solid understanding from the database to the web UI. Using the latest technologies means you must be willing to continuously learn new things.
  
  

**In this role:**  

Develop, test and maintain system functionality based on agile user stories
  
Utilize the latest technologies such as React and Node.js
  
Leverage and maintain a modern, secure, serverless AWS cloud hosted platform
  
Troubleshoot and debug issues that arise
  
Maintaining technical documentation
  
Stay current and utilize the latest development tools and best practices
  
  

**What you will need to succeed:**  

5+ years of relevant technical development work experience
  
Must have experience with JavaScript, full web application stack
  
Solid understanding from the database to the web UI
  
Experience with Amazon Web Services
  
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  
Ability to think and act both strategically and tactically
  
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team
  
Strong analytical and multitasking skills
  
Curiosity and a strong desire to learn and grow your technical skillset
  
Experience working on a cross functional Agile Scrum team
  
  

**Nice to have:**  

Experience with SQL databases
  
Experience with Datadog, AWS Cloudwatch, or similar application / infrastructure monitoring tools
  
Experience with GitHub, AWS CodePipeline, or similar CI/CD tools
  
  

Why IDEXX?
  
We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from diseases. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 10,000 talented people.
  
  

So, what does that mean for you? We enrich the livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery. At IDEXX, you will be supported by competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement.
  
  

Let’s pursue what matters together.
  
  

IDEXX values a diverse workforce and workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBTQ+ individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply.
  
  

IDEXX is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, or any protected category prohibited by local, state, or federal laws.
  
  

**What you can expect from us:**  

* Base annual salary target: $100,000 - $125,000 (yes, we do have flexibility if needed)
* Opportunity for annual cash bonus
* Health / Dental / Vision Benefits Day-One
* 5% matching 401k
* Additional benefits including but not limited to financial support, pet insurance, mental health resources, volunteer paid days off, employee stock program, foundation donation matching, and much more!


#LI-REMOTE

title: IT- Senior Data Services Developer
description:
**Summary:**  

The Senior Data Services Developer creates, enhances, and maintains data services systems that drive the organizational data analytics practices. This includes designing, developing, testing, maintaining, and monitoring solutions that contribute to the Enterprise Data Store.
  
  

This position includes working with other developers (internal and external), IT Managers, Business Analysts, and Business Subject Matter Experts during the full software life cycle. This role is responsible for providing off-hours support for the supported systems and should be able to troubleshoot issues to determine root cause and recommend remediation to prevent future outages.
  
  

This role may include mentoring or onboarding other development resources but has no direct reports.
  
  

**Duties:**  

* Designing, developing, testing, maintaining, and monitoring solutions that contribute to the Enterprise Data Store.
* Troubleshoot reported issues to determine root cause and remediation steps, including technical issues and data related issues.
* Contribute to enterprise data and analytics capabilities, data solutions, and analytics technology roadmaps.
* Conduct code reviews and ensure QA processes are followed.
* Provide written technical design documentation and unit test any system changes.
* Assures data quality related to data migration, conversion, and loading proceses following Data Governance standards.
* Maintain system stability, both on and off hours.
* Participate in code deployment and be responsible for optimizing the code migration process.
* Contribute to and adhere to development standards and guidelines for the Enterprise and team.
* Ensures reporting, modeling, and ETL projects and initiatives are supported fully and run smoothly.
* Contribute to the technical direction for data services, including the data warehouses and data lakes.
* Contributes technical expertise to large scale initiatives; maintains knowledge of technology industry advances impacting application development or technology management.
* May serve as administrator for Software Development Life Cycle toolsets and processes used by the team.
* Other duties as assigned.
* Occasional travel required for In-Person department meetings, planning sessions, project sessions, or facility walk-throughs, less than 10%.


**Education and Qualifications:**  

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, IT, Software Engineering or equivalent preferred.
  
Ability to document, communicate, implement, and operationalize complex architectures.
  
Ability to effectively communicate with technical and non-technical resources.
  
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Arrowhead is unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of employment visas currently.
  
Willingness to work off-hours during on-call, deployments, outages, and/or as projects require.
  
  

**Required Experience:**  

7+ years of Information Technology experience with a minimum of 8 years in data architecture and data solutions required.
  
5+ years of experience with relational and dimensional databases.
  
5+ years of experience with ETL tools and processes.
  
In-depth knowledge of modern enterprise data architectures, monitoring, security controls, and privacy laws that impact enterprise solutions.
  
Demonstrate proficiency across the SQL Server Stack (SSRS, SSIS, SSAS, and SSMS).
  
  

**Preferred Experience:**  

Experience with hybrid cloud data solutions, such as Azure data factory, AWS Glue, Spark, Data Lake, Data Warehouse, Data Marts, Power BI, Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics
  
Experience with Product Information Management systems, such as Agility Multichannel Systems or PIMCORE.
  
Experience with multiple ERP systems, such as NetSuite One World ERP, S2K, Prophet 21, Dynamics GP.
  
Experience database administration of SQL Server.
  
Experience with SSIS, Boomi, Hitachi Pentaho ETL Tool, or similar.
  
Experience with database development, such as SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, NoSQL, PostgreSQL.
  
Experience with multiple project methodologies, including Agile, Kanban, Waterfall, and Scrum.
  
Experience administering and creating reports and dashboards in PowerBI, Tableau, or other reporting systems.
  
Experience in the Manufacturing and Distribution industries.
  
Familiarity with multiple data schemas used in dimensional databases, such as Star, Snowflake, Galaxy,
  
Certification in Microsoft Azure, .NET SQL Server, C#, AWS, or related technologies a Plus.
  
  

**Physical Demands:**  

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee is frequently required to sit and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision and ability to adjust focus.
  
  

**Working Conditions:**  

Heated and air-conditioned office.

title: Sr IT Engineer
description:
Founded in 2017, REPS & Co. is a future leader in the entertainment industry specializing in ticketing for live events. Our founders and key staff are industry veterans with fresh ideas for the ticketing industry. We provide tickets to many events and shows across the nation including music, sports and theatrical performances. We pride ourselves in offering the best experience for the best price to our customers. Our technology is what allows us to outperform our competitors and deliver an unforgettable experience to fans. In 2019 we were named as one of San Diego Union Tribune's Top Workplaces and were the recipient of the Innovation Spotlight Award.


**Overview**



We are looking to hire an experienced Senior IT Engineer that will oversee IT business operations, and other computer systems in our organization. This role will work with our team in troubleshooting software problems and implementing new IT business processes. He will be involved in all aspects of the computer systems in an organization, including planning, designing, implementing, troubleshooting, updating, and repairing. He will also be responsible for evaluating and identifying optimal cloud solutions, designing configurations, installing software, managing network systems, and training staff on correct operating procedures. The Senior IT Engineer should have extensive experience maintaining large-scale computer systems, the ability to project manage, and excellent troubleshooting skills. He can also design and maintain a dynamic and stable system to perfectly meet the needs of the company. This role will include mentorship to other IT team members in the department. This role must have a broad knowledge of technologies and enjoy solving problems, must have excellent communication skills, and keep up-to-date on the latest developments and trends in the industry.



We are excited to add an IT Engineer to our growing team!


**The ideal candidate will be responsible for**


* Being the go-to technical subject matter expert for the other departments and IT team.
* Collaborating with engineering and development teams to evaluate and identify optimal cloud solutions.
* Identifying and troubleshooting system problems by acknowledging the problem and its root cause and fixing it
* Identifying necessary improvements to computer systems which includes testing and observing the existing system to identify areas that require development
* Design, implement, and troubleshoot processes to ensure efficient IT business operations in an organization
* Educating teams on the implementation of new cloud technologies and initiatives.
* Developing and maintaining cloud solutions in accordance with best practices.
* Regularly reviewing existing systems and making recommendations for improvements.
* Interacting with clients, providing cloud support, and making recommendations based on client needs.
* Configuring and testing new computer systems to help identify potential problems and observe their level of security
* Documenting work and creating reports
* Managing multiple projects simultaneously
* Collaborate with programmers, developers, and designers to achieve set objectives
* Working with interdisciplinary teams to craft IT solutions
* Communicating complex information to a non-technological audience
* Mentor other IT members.

**Qualifications**


* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a similar field.
* At least 5 years of experience in the field of cloud computing.
* 2+ years of experience in Google Workspace
* 4+ years of experience in AWS, and GCP
* Familiarity with general OS systems, Enterprise, programming languages, and Office software.
* Familiarity with email protocols.
* Ability to manage projects in Jira or similar products.
* Good communication skills.
* Ability to troubleshoot complex software and hardware issues.
* Knowledge of database and networking security systems.
* Good understanding of IT Security best practices.

title: Senior Software Developer, Applications
description:
Overview:
**TISTA Science and Technology Corporation**, a CMMI Maturity Level 3 company, focuses on delivering information technology and professional services to Federal and State agencies. TISTA is recognized in 2019 by Inc. 5000 as one of the fastest growing private companies in the US. TISTA is also a recipient of 2019 Top Veteran-Owned Companies by the Washington Business Journal. TISTA also received a 2018 Moxie Award in the GovCon category.  

Are you a **Senior Software Developer, Applications**who would like to have a positive impact for thousands of people? If so, we may have an opportunity for you!

 **TISTA** associates enjoy above Industry Healthcare Benefits, Remote Working Options, Paid Time Off, Training/Certification opportunities, Healthcare Savings Account & Flexible Savings Account, Paid Life Insurance, Short-term & Long-term Disability, 401K Match, Tuition Reimbursement, Employee Assistance Program, Paid Holidays, Military Leave, and much more!


Responsibilities:
* Collaborate with customers to identify end-user requirements and specifications, analyze user needs and designs software for customer use
* Lead detailed analysis of the current system, program revisions, maintenance, enhancements and post implementation support of the application/system/database utilizing an Agile Approach
* Participate in and/or lead daily scrum meetings, resource estimation of incoming updates and additions to the application
* Participate in Increment Planning (PI) preparation activities as well as in PI planning events to ensure consideration of development roadmap and software delivery value stream requirements
* Provide application development support for the Microsoft suite of development tools and technologies including C# or VB.NET, SQL Server, and web development skills
* Develop code and designs software applications based on user specifications
* Institutionalize design considering user-centric HCD principles, Scaled Agile Methodologies as input to deliver scalable business services enabling inter/intra-agency data sharing
* Modify existing software to correct errors or improve performance
* Monitor and assist with software testing and validation procedures and programming
* Develop unit test cases to unit test the applications developed by using frameworks such as Junit and Mockito
* Work on integrating the end to end software delivery model by implementing and using CI/CD (Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery) using frameworks and orchestration systems such as Jenkins, Kubernetes and Docker
* Design algorithms and flowcharts to create new software programs and systems
* Troubleshooting, debugging, maintaining and improving existing software
* Compile and assess user feedback to improve software performance
* Observing user feedback to recommend improvements to existing software products
* Developing technical documentation to guide future software development projects
* Other duties as assigned


Qualifications:  

* Proficiency in popular coding languages including Python, Java and C++ and frameworks or systems such as AngularJS and Git
* Minimum of 2 years demonstrated experience in developing API’s including inter-agency data sharing
* AWS certification(s) a plus
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to perform independent analysis and complete assigned tasks with minimal supervision
* Experience with Agile and Scrum development methodologies
* Familiarity with Atlassian’s Jira and Confluence, Docker and Kubernetes
* Experience with backend web frameworks (e.g. Django, Flask)
* Experience configuring web servers (e.g. Apache)
* Understanding of Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) approach
* Experience working in a SaaS and PaaS environment
* Experience in DevSecOps and CI/CD workflows including use of GitOps
* Strong interpersonal skills and an ability to interact with team members and senior managers
* Strong problem-solving and communication skills
* Knowledge of Object-Relational Mapping frameworks
* Ability to learn quickly and work independently or as part of a team

 **Education:*** Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field and 4 years’ working experience

**Clearance:*** Ability to obtain Moderate Background Investigation (MBI) clearance

 **Location:*** Remote

**Salary Information:**

* The pay for this position ranges from $84,750 to $100,000.
* The actual salary offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.
* Also, certain positions are eligible for additional forms of compensation, such as bonuses.
* TISTA associates are eligible to participate in our comprehensive benefits plan! More information can be found here: https://tistatech.com/working-at-tista/
